name: 王永順
objective:
The class will be taught in-person. In-person sessions will include active gameplay with another student or coach. This is an introductory course teaching the fundamental skills of table tennis. It is assumed that students enrolled in the class have little or no experience in table tennis. Class will be focusing on developing the following skills: racket grip, possible racket holding angles, basic strokes, rules, scoring, strategy, etiquette, practice drills, spin, singles play.
Not limited to a students with advance level would like to join. For those of who should notice, some advance techniques would not be included in the course.

Present the student fundamental skills and knowledge of table tennis.
Improve each student's skills in hitting all of the basic strokes: forehand counterhit; backhand
counterhit(drive); backhand flick(flip); backhand block; service return, and footwork.
Introduce each student to the basic rules, scoring, and footwork.
Offer each student an opportunity to apply their skill and knowledge in match play.
Make each student aware of the primary differences in strategies for singles and doubles and provide an
opportunity to implement this information in actual match play.
Provide each student with information about current table tennis trends, specifically regarding local
table tennis programs, professional tournaments and equipment selection.
Encourage each student to pursue table tennis as a lifetime leisure activity.
schedule:
#1~4weeks 
Introductory phase: learning fundamental skills and knowledge.
  EX., racket holding,  techniques of forehand, backhand, server.

#5~10weeks
Gameplay phase: game rules introduction and practicing.
During this phase, all students are required to play with other classmates in both single and double game match to familiar processes of the play.

#11~18weeks
Matching phase: single an double game competitions.
In this period, all students are randomly assign to a groups for competitions. For the final grade, to 40 points in total is requires for student to pass the class.
